content.title: Our Approach
content.body:
We love tending smaller gardens in which plants play the starring role. 
Whether working with an existing border or starting from scratch, we love making planting schemes look as good as they can throughout the year.
With a wide plant knowledge and understanding of planting design principles, we can work with you to create plant communities which look right together, and are happy in the specific conditions of your garden.
Our primary goal is to ensure your plants are as healthy and vigorous as possible. This is achieved through carefully matching plants to their environment and improving the soil with organic matter.  
Thriving plants not only look better for longer, they are also naturally resistant to pests, disease and the varied challenges of extreme and unpredictable weather.
We specialise in tending gardens with a natural feel - ranging from light-touch maintenance for 'wild' gardens to more designed planting schemes which mimic natural ecosystems - woodland, prairie, bog or gravel gardens.

content.title: What we do
content.body:
We love designing and maintaining smaller gardens in which plants play the starring role, and wildlife is actively encouraged.

Combining practical horticultural knowledge with garden design training, we plan and nurture plant communities which look great together and are happy in the specific conditions of your garden.

We operate in Kendal and nearby villages.

content.title: Organic garden maintenance
content.body:
We offer a regular maintenance service informed by both practical horticultural knowledge (RHS qualified to Level 2) and garden design principles (NOCN qualified to Level 3).

We provide a wide range of  maintenance services for the smaller garden, with a focus on:

- Border planning and maintenance
- Soil care and preparation
- Plant and bulb selection advice
- Shrub and small tree pruning
- Small vegetable plot management
- Plant propagation
- Small pond installation and planting
- Wildflower lawns

content.title: How does your garden grow?
content.body: Gardening is a collaboration with nature, not a battle. Encouraging birds, hedgehogs and frogs can helps control slugs. Selectively welcoming self-seeders like Welsh poppies and foxgloves adds an element of spontaneity. Neat and tidy doesn't always do it.

cards.title: Feed your soil
cards.body: A thriving garden begins with understanding your soil and its needs. We often recommend adding large amounts of organic matter, such as mushroom compost, in the early spring. This adds nutrients, suppresses weeds and helps soil retain moisture through the season.

cards.title: Right plant, right place
cards.body: From damp, shady spots to dry, sunny banks it is vital to choose plants which will thrive in the specific growing conditions of your garden. Healthy, vigorous plants are naturally more pest and drought-resistent and can often be divided to produce more plants for your garden.

content.title: Garden and planting design
content.body: Are you looking to have your garden re-designed in a way that balances the needs of the people who use it and the wildlife which inhabits it? Do you want help creating a resilient, biodiverse garden which also expresses your own personality and tastes?

cards.title: Planting plans
cards.body: Producing detailed planting plans for your borders ensures that they look great through the year, while avoiding wasting time and money on plants which fail to thrive in your garden's conditions or only make a visual contribution for a short time.

cards.title: Garden designs
cards.body: If you want to remodel your whole or part of your garden, however small, we can produce detailed plans which can be used by landscapers as construction blueprints. We collaborate with you at every stage to produce a design which meets your aesthetic, practical and ethical requirements.

cards.title: Kendal back garden
cards.body: We designed a complete garden layout and planting scheme for a small back garden as part of a renovation project. The challenge was to combine lush planting alongside an occasional parking area, lawn for play and patio for entertaining.

cards.title: Baslow community orchard
cards.body: We were commissioned to produce plans and sketches for a proposed community orchard in a Peak District village. The designs helped secure local support and funding, and the orchard is now a much-loved and fruitful communal space.
